intro: Pimelea curviflora subsp. gracilis, commonly known as slender bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical flower spikes. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and the flowers are usually red or pink in color. It is a low-growing shrub that plays an important role in its native ecosystem.
